data.author: William Woodall
data.message:
Remove -Werror from Clang compile options (#220)

While useful, in my opinion it's not appropriate to set `-Werror` the `CMakeLists.txt`, instead allowing the user to set it if they wish, or setting it during CI if you want to catch warnings during testing.

Signed-off-by: William Woodall <william@osrfoundation.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
[env] Add `set_env_var` function (#150)

* [env] Add `set_env_var` function

This commit adds the `set_env_var` function, which is essentially an
`rcpputils` wrapper around `rcutils_set_env`.

In doing so, also:
- Rename `get_env.{hpp,cpp}` to `env.{hpp,cpp}`
- Update FEATURES.md with new signature

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <aprotyas@u.rochester.edu>

* Add tests for `set_env_var` function

Also, renamed `test_get_env.cpp` to `test_env.cpp` to reflect
the addition of a new function.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <aprotyas@u.rochester.edu>

* Change `get_env.hpp` header includes to `env.hpp`

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <aprotyas@u.rochester.edu>

* Re-add (and deprecate) `get_env.hpp`

It's better to deprecate the header on a tick-tock cycle rather than
removing it outright, so this commit reverts the deletion and actually
deprecates the header.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <aprotyas@u.rochester.edu>

data.message:
`rcpputils::fs`: Fix doxygen parameter identifier (#142)

The `create_directories` function had a typo in its doxygen tags.
Namely, `path` -> `p`.

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Make thread safety macro C++ standards compliant (#141)

Identifiers with double underscores are reserved by the standard.
This commit also allows removing the `@cond`/`@endcond` statements
used to exclude `RCPPUTILS_THREAD_SAFETY_ANNOTATIONS_ATTRIBUTE__`
from Doxygen.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Fix API documentation for clean `rosdoc2` build (#139)

* Include markdown files and generate XML in Doxyfile

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Fix `rcppmath::clamp` function comment header

Previously, Doxygen was returning warnings about undocumented function
parameters, which this commit addresses.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Fix `rcpputils::fs`-related doxygen errors/warns

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Fix `rcpputils::shared_library` doxygen warnings

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Doxygen: conditionally excluding a `split` func

`split(const std::string&, char, InsertIterator&, bool)` was used
privately by `split(const std::string&, char, bool)`. Since the latter
signature was caushing `breathe` to choke at the template paramater list
anyway, it was conditionally excluded from Doxygen visibility.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Fix Doxygen warnings from thread safety annotation

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Doxygen: exclude `THREAD_ANNOTATION_ATTRIBUTE__`

The macro in question produces an anonymous hyperlink error when exhale
produces the `Define THREAD_ANNOTATION_ATTRIBUTE__` statement in its
generated `.rst` file. Since this macro itself is not used publicly, and
there is no obvious approach to fix the warning about anonymous
hpyerlinks, I have conditionally excluded that macro from Doxygen.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Append `param` command with `in/out/inout` attribs

This commit targets the `filesystem_helper.hpp` and the `asserts.hpp`
headers, to increase uniformity of doxygen commands across the package.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Improve `rcppmath` Doxygen documentation (#138)

This PR broadly attempts to make `rcppmath` documentation more detailed, as well as fixes some Doxygen issues that previously prevented `rcppmath` documentation from building correctly using `rosdoc2`.

Specifically:
* Documented rolling mean accumulator methods.
* For the clamping methods:
  * Added \sa tag instead of explicitly asking user to "see the other function".
  * nit: Capitalization.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Improve documentation of utilities in docs/FEATURES.md (#137)

This PR does the following:

* Improve Doxygen linking between entities listed in `docs/FEATURES.md` and actual class/function documentation.
* Adds more detail about specific header files: particularly `find_library.hpp`, string helpers, and `shared_library.hpp`.
* Adds undocumented utilities into docs/FEATURES.md, namely: `process.hpp`, `get_env.hpp`, and `scope_exit.hpp`.
* Fix some grammatical nitpicks.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Abrar Rahman Protyasha
data.message:
Include `rcppmath` utilities in docs/FEATURES.md (#136)

* Include `rcppmath` utilities in docs/FEATURES.md

Namely:
* Clamping
* Rolling mean accumulator

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

* Fix typo in docs/FEATURES.md

Minor patch.

Co-authored-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* docs/FEATURES.md: Change bullet list format for consistency

Bullet lists under the 'Rolling mean accumulator' header in docs/FEATURES.md
have been reformatted to read as:
`* item: description`
This ensures consistency in bullet list formatting with the rest of the document.

Signed-off-by: Abrar Rahman Protyasha <abrar@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make sure to not try to index into an empty path. (#113)

This was a bug introduced by https://github.com/ros2/rcpputils/pull/112,
but only shows up on Windows Debug for some reason.  Regardless,
we should not try to index into an empty string.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix working with filesystem parent paths. (#112)

* Fix working with filesystem parent paths.

I fixed a few problems found when working with parent paths:

1.  Asking for the first parent path of an absolute path
would add a duplicate separator at the beginning.  I fixed
this by checking to see if the separator already exists,
and skipping if there is already one.
2.  Asking for the grandparent path of an absolute path
would return a relative path, which is very incorrect.  The
problem here turned out to be that we were not propagating
empty vector pieces from a child to a parent, and so the
grandparent would miss out that it was supposed to be absolute.
Fix this by always adding all pieces to the parents, even
when they are empty.
3.  Added tests for the above situations.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Add an ASSERT to the pointer traits tests. (#111)

What's happening here is that we are using the initialization
of the pointer to initialize the "auto" type of the variable,
and then using compile-time checks to check on it.  Because
of this, clang static analysis thinks that the variable is
unused (which it is, at runtime).  Since that is not the
purpose of the test, just put a bogus ASSERT_TRUE in that uses
the variable and quiets clang static analysis.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Fix parent_path() for empty paths and paths of length one (#73)

* Add tests for path.exists()

This clarifies the expected output for empty, current, and parent paths.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix edge case when calling parent_path() with path length one

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix edge case when calling parent_path() with empty path

In this case, return an empty path.
Previously, this would result in a segmentation fault.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Add test for parent of root

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Fix Windows test for parent of absolute path

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Add exists() test for root

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Allow for absolute paths starting with C:\ and \ on Windows

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Add get_executable_name() function (#70)

This function wraps rcutils_get_executable_name and takes care of the
allocator and throws an exception when an error occurs.

The rcutils_get_executable_name implementation doesn't set any error
information when it fails, and from reading through the implementation
and the documentation for the system functions it calls, an error should
be extremely unlikely. A generic failure message is the best I can do.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Align path combine behavior with C++17 (#68)

Combining a path with an absolute path yields only the absolute path in
the C++17 implementation.

The current behavior here is to smush them together anyway.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Remove mention of random file from temporary_directory_path doc (#64)

The documented return value for this function seems to reference a
different temp function - one that returns a random temp filename. The
implementation is returning the path to a temp directory as instructed
through environment variables and not a path to a file.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>
